import React, { Component } from "react"; export default class SettingsOverlay extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { prioritiesKeywords: props.startingKeywords === "both" || props.startingKeywords === "priorities", datesKeywords: props.startingKeywords === "both" || props.startingKeywords === "dates", sorting: props.startingSorting, background: props.startingBackground, }; } setSorting(e) { const sortingType = e.currentTarget.dataset.type; this.setState({ sorting: sortingType }); } setKeywords(e) { const keywordType = e.currentTarget.dataset.type; this.setState({ keywords: keywordType }); } render() { console.log(this.state.sorting); const classes = "settings-overlay shadow font-grey p-4" + (this.props.displaying ? " settings-overlay-displayed" : ""); return (

); } }
